text: climate change is hitting hard and it's
not just the planet that's suffering
your employees health is at risk too in
my recent hbr article I offer five key
steps to protect them and keep your
business thriving first do a climate
change and health audit know where your
Workforce is most vulnerable map out
risks and track them over time and use
tools like climate risk analytics and
heat mapping to include employee data
second develop and deploy early Warning
Systems an alert about poor air quality
can protect employees with asthma just
like security threat warnings protect
protect your Workforce third learn from
in partner with the public sector adapt
public sector Frameworks like the US
cdc's brace framework that guides Public
Health departments in forecasting
climate impacts projecting related
Health outcomes and implementing
interventions to protect vulnerable
populations and team up with experts
from Hospital systems and public health
organizations for specialized knowledge
and guidance fourth don't overlook
mental health climate anxiety is real
and affects productivity integrate Eco
anxiety into your mental health
framework work and use public sector
playbooks to address it finally lead by
being transparent about climate risks
communicate openly with your employees
about the health impacts of climate
change use multiple channels to educate
and engage them and be transparent with
external stakeholders too including in
your company's sustainability of report
by taking these steps you not only
protect your employees but also
strengthen your business and contribute
to Public Health for more details go to
hbr.org
